fields.description:
The TaskBoard is a primary workflow tool for Agile/Scrum teams.

We need to be able to interact with the comments easily from the TaskBoard (currently it requires navigating away from the TaskBoard - bad).

We should have the ability to click a 'comments' link and have a modal popout of the full comment thread for an issue.

We should also be able to post comments in that same modal.

Bonus feature: a comments tooltip showing the recent 3ish comments without even needing a click.

Mantra: No navigation away from the TaskBoard to handle comments!
fields.summary: Comments pop-out in TaskBoard

fields.description:
One failed rank operation (on a db level) and the RankIndexService goes into read-only/blocked mode.

Also, "theoretically" in that specific case it could happen that the first custom field fails with said error (thus creating the transaction but not clearing it out after execution), and subsequently a different rank field is loaded (which will rerun the transaction log). As a result you end up with properly cleaned up transaction log, yet the memory representation of the first rank index has NOT been adapted to reflect that change.

Investigate this possible bug plus decide on the level of hardening we should add to the current code
fields.summary: Harden/fix rank transaction recovery in RankIndexService (x)

fields.description:
When creating initial quick filters et. al. for a board, we push into the database i18n keys and then resolve them on every request.

Firstly, this has the downside that all user entered data for these entities goes through the i18n resolver for no reason.

Secondly, if two users view the same board they can see things in different languages. This feels strange, particularly given this is not how any user created entities will behave
fields.summary: Database stored data shouldn't go through the i18n resolver

fields.description:
Start Date and End Date are stored at _minute_ precision. Change history is stored at _millisecond_ precision. Therefore you can end up in a situation where
* A story is given story point value at 12:00:30
* The sprint is started (including this story) at 12:00:45
* The Burndown chart then processes the change history and decides that the story point change occurred *after* the sprint started.
fields.summary: Calculation of data for Burndown needs to take into account lack of precision on Start and End Dates

fields.description:
(This may not be a bug -- it may be subjective.)

When using the Create Rapid Board dialog, not in the context of a specific preset (i.e. on the Rapid Board itself), the first step is to choose a preset (or choose advanced). If a preset is chosen, the second step is to then enter a name and projects.

The second step's title should reflect the preset chosen in the first step, so that the user knows which board they are creating, and to be consistent with the Create Project & Rapid Board dialog.
fields.summary: Second Step of Advanced Rapid Board Create dialog should reflect preset chosen in first step

fields.description:
This is an old bug, most likely a regression.

# Open Create Rapid Board dialog
# Type in a Rapid Board name
# Choose a project from the list
# Type an invalid character into the project field, after your valid project
# Click "Create"
# Validation informs you of the invalid project name, and disables Create button
# Delete invalid project name

Create button is still disabled.

fields.description:
On an instance with Web Sudo enabled:
* Click "Create Project" in the "Classic Scrum" part of Getting Started
* You will see the Web Sudo dialog
* Click "cancel"

You are taken to JIRA's Administration page instead of just closing the dialog
fields.summary: Web Sudo "cancel" link on Getting Started takes you to Admin page

fields.description:
Looking at GreenHopper Project Progress gadget in my dashboard it says 10 issues are In Progress, I click on the link and it opens up a search, where it turns out that 2 of the issues are resolved but have a resolution of duplicate/won't fix.

This is an error when 2 resolved issues are showing for In Progress.

The search the progress indicator is using is:

{code:jql} 
project = my-project AND (fixVersion = "Sprint 1" OR "Release Version History" = "Sprint 1") AND (status = Resolved AND resolution in (Duplicate, "Cannot Reproduce", "Won't Fix", Fixed) OR status in (Reopened, "In Progress") AND resolution = Unresolved OR status = Resolved AND resolution = Incomplete) ORDER BY priority ASC, key ASC
{code} 

I think this JQL is wrong, and should not be looking for Duplicate, "Cannot Reproduce", "Won't Fix" in the context of In Progress.
 
Originally discussed at
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/16157/bug-in-greenhopper-project-progress-gadget-showing-too-many-in-progress-issues
fields.summary: Project progress Gadget - showing too many In Progress issues

fields.description:
Most fields displayed in a task-card can be edited by the user.  As we restrict which fields can be edited through JIRA (by not placing them on the 'Edit Issue' screens), we would expect GreenHopper to offer similar functionality.  As things stand, a user can bypass our business-logic simply by going to the Planning Board or Task Board and clicking on a field to edit it.

Inline editing can be disabled by removing some of the Actions from GH's atlassian-plugin.xml file, but this doesn't remove the 'Click to Edit' tooltips or the edit icons on the cards.
fields.summary: It should be possible to disable inline-editing on task cards

fields.description:
[Migrated from https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11667/master-detail-navigation-in-planning-task-boards ]

In the planning and task board, I can bring up a detail view of an issue. (For example, via the "Edit in JIRA" action or the link with tooltip "View this issue in JIRA".)

There used to be an easy, single-click, obvious mechanism to exit the detail view, and return back to the prior context -- via a close button in an easy-to-find corner. No thinking was required.

In 4.4.1, that obvious, single-click mechanism for exiting the detail view seems to have been lost.

Workarounds:

* Use the browser back button to step back until finding the planning or task board.
* Find the "Agile" tab in the middle top, click it. This sends you back to the same board but the first page. Navigate back to the original page.
* Find "More Actions" button in the vast middle, click it, look for "Planning Board" or "Task Board, think about which one we were at before, click it.

Am I missing something? Is there a setting to open the detail view in the old dialog-like manner?

(By the way, I realize JIRA and GreenHopper began as separate products. However, it seems like integration should improve over time.)
fields.summary: Master-detail navigation in planning/task boards

Something along the lines of:

fields.summary: As a user I would like a list of the common keyboard shortcuts above the footer

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I want a quick filter on the rapid board which allows me to filter by an assignee of my choice. Currently there is only a quick filter for issues assigned to the current user. As a project manager or lead, it is useful to be able to easily see what work is assigned to who.

Instead of a simple button, the user would be presented with a dropdown list or a text field.

Swimlanes could be used for this, but I want to use swimlanes for other purposes while filtering by assignee.

More generally, it would be useful to be able to define quick filters with a variable parameter. That would solve this case and probably others.

{panel:title=Please Note}
This issue refers specifically to having a select style quick filter where the options are a list of existing values, in this case the assignee

This issue is minor because most teams can achieve the same outcome today by using creating JQL quickfilters of the form "assignee = <username>"
{panel}
fields.summary: Quick filter by ANY assignee on the RapidBoard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: To do backlog grooming across multiple projects, I use the Scrum rapid board plan tab. This should have the same options for looking at the stories as the per project plan board: stories should be shown with the 'List view' card style, not whatever it is now (I would think the 'Compact List' card style, but it doesn't even show story points, making planning sprints impossible).
fields.summary: As PO I want to see more than the summary on the Plan tab of the Scrum rapid board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When there is an JS error in Rapid Board, it often show big Red bar with "internal Server Error" message. The detail error message should be logged and display in the Error page.
fields.summary: Rapid Roard JavaScript Error Should Show More Detail instead of Big Red Box
